summary: This is an email from a federal prosecutor documenting a call with attorneys Mike Monico and Barry Spevack, who were representing an individual named Cohen. The attorneys inquired about filing a Rule 35 motion for a sentence reduction and hinted that Cohen had heard Donald Trump say things about Jeffrey Epstein, though they declined to provide details. The prosecutor noted they would consider providing more specifics about what Cohen had done to undermine his own credibility.

Spevack, along with Mike Monico, called the prosecutor on behalf of Cohen, indicating they represent him.
Cohen's attorneys claimed Cohen had heard Trump say things about Epstein, suggesting Cohen may possess information about Trump's knowledge or statements regarding Epstein.

events.title: Call regarding Rule 35 motion and Trump/Epstein claims
events.description: Attorneys Mike Monico and Barry Spevack called a federal prosecutor to inquire about filing a Rule 35 motion for their client Cohen and revealed that Cohen had heard Donald Trump say things about Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Prior conversation about Rule 35 motion
events.description: The prosecutor had previously informed Cohen's attorneys that they did not intend to file a Rule 35 motion for Cohen.

keyFacts: Cohen's attorneys, Mike Monico and Barry Spevack, contacted a federal prosecutor seeking a Rule 35 motion for a sentence reduction for their client.
During the call, the attorneys revealed that their client Cohen 'has heard Trump say things about Epstein,' but refused to provide further details at that time.
The prosecutor referenced a prior conversation on April 17, 2019, where they had already declined to file a Rule 35 motion for Cohen.
The prosecutor questioned what Cohen had done to undermine his own credibility, indicating skepticism or specific concerns about Cohen's reliability.
